messageBody:
Hi,

I am using Junit 3.8,
my objective is "To get the exact time taken by a test method which should not include setup and teardown time."
To achieve this, I have modified junit.framework.TestCase and junit.framework.TestSuite.

in TestCase, I have modified runBare() method

public void runBare() throws Throwable {


setUp();
try {
//Warm up the test
long startTime = System.currentTimeMillis();

runTest();
} catch (AssertionFailedError e) {
_failure = true;
// to store the records for functional failure
throw e;
}catch (Throwable e) {
_failure = true;
throw e;
}finally {
System.out.println("Method Execution taken:" + (System.currentTimeMillis() - startTime)) ;
tearDown();
}

}

this works fine for a testcase like this:
class validTest extends TestCase{
public void testValid(){
calculator.add(10);
calculator.multiply(10);
assertEquals(calculator.getResult(), 100);
}
}

But it will not work for a testcase like this

class notWorkingTest extends TestCase{
public void testNotWorking()
{
TestCase success= new TestCase("success") {
protected void runTest() {
}
};
verifySuccess(success);
}

void verifySuccess(TestCase test) {
junit.framework.TestResult result = test.run();
assertTrue(result.runCount() == 1);
}
}

Reason being, runBare() method of TestCase is reinvoked. I will end up providing wrong "Method Execution Time".
with this logic, for testNotWorking() method, I will be providing the Execution Time of "success". If have 10 such test.run() invoked from the
test method, I will be providing time taken for last test.run().

Can anybody provide inputs to solve this problem..

thanks
Shubha
